chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat

Goal:
{i : nat | i < n} -> pos n

Premises:
Notation pos := Fin.t
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
pos_nat : forall n : nat, pos n -> {i : nat | i < n}
Fin.to_nat = fix to_nat (m : nat) (n : pos m) {struct n} : {i : nat | i < m} := match n in (pos n0) return {i : nat | i < n0} with | @Fin.F1 j => exist (fun i : nat => i < S j) 0 (Nat.lt_0_succ j) | @Fin.FS n0 p => let (i, P) := to_nat n0 p in exist (fun i0 : nat => i0 < S n0) (S i) (lt_n_S i n0 P) end : forall m : nat, pos m -> {i : nat | i < m} Arguments Fin.to_nat {m}%nat_scope
Fin.to_nat_of_nat : forall h : ?p < ?n, Fin.to_nat (Fin.of_nat_lt h) = exist (fun i : nat => i < ?n) ?p h where ?p : [n : nat |- nat] ?n : [n : nat |- nat]
first_which : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, {P n} + {~ P n}) -> (exists x : nat, P x) -> {m : nat | P m /\ (forall x : nat, x < m -> ~ P x)}
Wf_Z.Z_of_nat_complete_inf : forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 x -> {n : nat | x = BinInt.Z.of_nat n}
O_or_S : forall n : nat, {m : nat | S m = n} + {0 = n}
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
min_dec : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, {P n} + {~ P n}) -> (exists n : nat, P n) -> {m : nat | P m /\ (forall x : nat, P x -> m <= x)}
le_lt_dec : forall n m : nat, {n <= m} + {m < n}
FinFun.bFun = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall x : nat, x < n -> f x < n : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bFun _%nat_scope _%function_scope
pos_O_inv = let pos_inv_t := fun n : nat => match n as x return (pos x -> Set) with | 0 => fun _ : pos 0 => False | S n0 => fun i : pos (S n0) => ((i = pos0) + {p : pos n0 | i = pos_nxt p})%type end in let pos_inv := fun (_tmp : nat) (p0 : pos _tmp) => match p0 as t in (pos n) return (pos_inv_t n t) with | @Fin.F1 n => inl eq_refl | @Fin.FS n p => inr (exist (fun p1 : pos n => pos_nxt p = pos_nxt p1) p eq_refl) end in pos_inv 0 : pos 0 -> False
FinFun.bSurjective = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall y : nat, y < n -> exists x : nat, x < n /\ f x = y : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bSurjective _%nat_scope _%function_scope
FinFun.bInjective = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall x y : nat, x < n -> y < n -> f x = f y -> x = y : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bInjective _%nat_scope _%function_scope
list_upper_bound : forall l : list nat, {m : nat | forall x : nat, In x l -> x < m}
Fin.of_nat_lt = fix of_nat_lt (p n : nat) {struct p} : p < n -> pos n := match n as n0 return (p < n0 -> pos n0) with | 0 => fun H : p < 0 => False_rect (pos 0) (Nat.nlt_0_r p H) | S n' => match p as p0 return (p0 < S n' -> pos (S n')) with | 0 => fun _ : 0 < S n' => pos0 | S p' => fun H : S p' < S n' => pos_nxt (of_nat_lt p' n' (lt_S_n p' n' H)) end end : forall p n : nat, p < n -> pos n Arguments Fin.of_nat_lt {p n}%nat_scope
Init.Nat.eqb = fix eqb (n m : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0 => match m with | 0 => true | S _ => false end | S n' => match m with | 0 => false | S m' => eqb n' m' end end : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments Init.Nat.eqb (_ _)%nat_scope
nat2pos : forall n x : nat, x < n -> pos n
pos_map = fun m n : nat => pos m -> pos n : nat -> nat -> Set Arguments pos_map (_ _)%nat_scope
FinFun.Fin2Restrict.extend : forall n : nat, (pos n -> pos n) -> nat -> nat
Fin.weak : forall p : nat, (pos ?m -> pos ?n) -> pos (p + ?m) -> pos (p + ?n) where ?m : [n : nat |- nat] ?n : [n : nat |- nat]
FinFun.Fin2Restrict.restrict : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat), FinFun.bFun n f -> pos n -> pos n
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
lt_S_n : forall n m : nat, S n < S m -> n < m
lt_n_S : forall n m : nat, n < m -> S n < S m
FinFun.Fin2Restrict.extend_n2f : forall (n : nat) (f : pos n -> pos n) (x : nat) (h : x < n), Fin.of_nat_lt (FinFun.Fin2Restrict.extend_ok f h) = f (Fin.of_nat_lt h)
Inductive t : nat -> Set := F1 : forall n : nat, pos (S n) | FS : forall n : nat, pos n -> pos (S n) Arguments Fin.t _%nat_scope Arguments Fin.F1 {n}%nat_scope Arguments Fin.FS {n}%nat_scope
FinFun.Fin2Restrict.restrict_n2f : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) (hf : FinFun.bFun n f) (x : nat) (h : x < n), FinFun.Fin2Restrict.restrict hf (Fin.of_nat_lt h) = Fin.of_nat_lt (hf x h)
pos2nat : forall n : nat, pos n -> nat
Fin.cast : pos ?m -> forall n0 : nat, ?m = n0 -> pos n0 where ?m : [n : nat |- nat]
